Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: The google doc doesn't have a sheet on it. I checked already.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Unless there's a separate google doc. But the one with tokens, channels, etc., doesn't have a tab for gateways.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: setting up the gateway is quite complex

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: hmm

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: using the gateway is much simpler

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to use the gateway, you send a deposit transaction to the gateway deposit address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this will have the amount you are depositing and also a claim vout, which just has the destination address and a txfee amount

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once you have a deposit txid from the external chain, then you make a gatewaysdeposit transaction with all the details about it. many different things and end users wont understand it

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Ok. 

I will need the exact inputs and ouputs that a user would see in the terminal.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but once you make a gatewaysdeposit tx, then when it confirms you will do a gatewaysclaim to claim the tokens

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: hmm, I'm wondering how best to approach this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after that you use the tokens, maybe transfer them, DEX them whatever. whoever owns the token can withdraw them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the withdraw process, requires to convert the token, doing a withdraw. then the gateway nodes process it and you get coins in the withdraw address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notice the deposit side, the depositor has control over the process, it is the depositors tx that gets the freely tradeable tokens into their claim address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for withdraw, you need to wait for the deposit address custodians to do an automated multisig withdraw

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe it is best to describe things at a high level first, as realistically there will need to be automated GUI/TUI to do the gatewaysdeposit tx

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Yes, that is a much more digestible explanation...

Do we expect a dApp developer to want documentation for this? 

Or is it just a CC-level developer that will want it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think we would want to have various implementations of code that uses the gateway, in different languages

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the dapp developer could then issue the deposit, generate the gatewaysdeposit and gatewaysclaim tx on the external coin -> token side and a withdraw on the token -> external coin side of things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: being able to automatically tokensize external crypto is quite useful

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: setting up the gateway is a whole different involved thing that is of interest to those that want to setup a gateway for a specific coin for their chain

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: how deep do you think I need to go in this documentation that's streamlined for new devs?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dapp devs or core CC devs?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: dapp devs

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: not core cc's

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I'm not working on the latter -- too far over my head

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just the general usage and maybe we can use tonyL TUI as an example of how to use it

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
okay, let's do that. We'll just have an explanation for how to use an existing gateway that's made available to them, and then have a link to some other documentation that teaches how to set one up from scratch, and mention that it's more challenging.

Does that work?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sure

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are two main types of auctions that need to be supported

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one for the nonfungible tokens, which have a supply of 1

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: another would be for the ICO type of scenario where there are X amount of tokens for sale

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there would be an auctioncreate rpc call to start the auction and based on its opreturn parameters, people can lock funds to bid

Author: IndieBlock#3081
Content: Ill get a spec written/drawn up with the details you give me then you can confirm etc.

Author: IndieBlock#3081
Content: then ill work to that ^

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: cancel to unlock the funds and at the end of the auction either get back their losing bid or whatever they bid on

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: something like that

Author: IndieBlock#3081
Content: Sounds fairly straight forward.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, once you are familiar with how to lock/unlock funds in the CC context

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: let me know when you are ready for more details

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@IndieBlock 

Keep in mind, the notary node elections come up again at the end of Q1 2019.

Notary nodes are elected by an ecosystem-wide stake-weighted vote, and vote are typically cast in favor of engaged and contributing developers, such as yourself!

For their services, notary nodes receive a mining advantage on the KMD main chain.

let me know if you have questions or would like to run.
